snippet: The F.C.C. appears poised to vote on a measure to require local television stations to upload information about political advertising to an F.C.C. Web site.
abstract: Federal Communications Commission appears poised to move ahead on a measure to require local television stations to upload information about political advertising to a central Web site; owners of local stations have tried to block the proposal, but it appears likely to be approved in the coming month.
lead_paragraph: The F.C.C. appears poised to vote on a measure to require local television stations to upload information about political advertising to an F.C.C. Web site.

headline.seo: F.C.C. Pushes for Web Site on Political Ad Spending on TV
headline.main: F.C.C. Pushes for Web Site on TV Political Ad Spending
headline.print_headline: F.C.C. Pushes for Web Site On TV Political Ad Spending
